title: Chicanx Theatre
description: This course examines Chicanx theatre as a dynamic, multivocal, aesthetically complex, and generative site for the exploration of Chicanx history, politics, and cultural identity. Students engage with a variety of plays and performance artists that track the different themes and inquiries that have emerged out of the Chicano movement. Cross-listed with ETHN 132. Students may receive credit for one of the following: TDHT 110 or ETHN 132. No prior knowledge in theatre history is needed. Prerequisites: upper-division standing or consent of instructor.
